Organism_Record.Function_Summary: Repressor of the galactose operon. Binds galactose as an inducer.

Funtion.Detail: Protein which interferes with transcription, usually by binding to specific sites on DNA. Also used for proteins which repress translation.

Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a specific DNA sequence in order to modulate transcription. The transcription factor may or may not also interact selectively with a protein or macromolecular complex.
Funtion.Keyword: Sequence-specific DNA binding transcription factor activity

Funtion.Detail: Any molecular function by which a gene product interacts selectively with DNA (deoxyribonucleic acid).

BioProcess.Detail: The cellular synthesis of either RNA on a template of DNA or DNA on a template of RNA.
The cellular synthesis of RNA on a template of DNA.
Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of the synthesis of either RNA on a template of DNA or DNA on a template of RNA.

The chemical reactions and pathways involving carbohydrates, any of a group of organic compounds based of the general formula Cx(H2O)y. Includes the formation of carbohydrate derivatives by the addition of a carbohydrate residue to another molecule.

The chemical reactions and pathways involving galactose, the aldohexose galacto-hexose. D-galactose is widely distributed in combined form in plants, animals and microorganisms as a constituent of oligo- and polysaccharides; it also occurs in galactolipids and as its glucoside in lactose and melibiose.

PDB.PDB_Title: Model of HTH-type transcriptional regulator galR
